title: Ticket #7624: clean up client to CredD interface for user impersonation
description:
Credential Management

*** THIS BRANCH HAS BEEN MERGED AND IS NOW CLOSED ***
All changes went into the V8_9_7-gt7624-cred-branch, now merged to V8_9_7-branch

NOTE: Documentation work to be done in ticket #7646

Summary

There are a couple places in the code where users interface with the CredD. One is during job submission when they specify in the submit file that they need certain OAuth tokens. Another is when they use the condor_store_cred command to manipulate their credentials.

Currently, condor_submit, condor_store_cred and python use the username that is running the process as the username argument when talking the Credd. This is passed to the Credd as a simple string in some cases, and in the ClassAd token requests that it sends to the CredD when submitting a job.

This circumvents the credential mapping that the CredD and SchedD would normally employ. As such, it is possible to have a mismatch between who the CredD will store credentials for and who the SchedD will run the job as. Or to have the CredD refuse to store the credential because the mapped authenticated name does not match the supplied name.

We propose to change this so that the CredD interprets a missing or empty username as a request to manage credentials for that mapped authenticated user. And the tools supply no username, counting on the CredD to fill that information in.

The exception to this will be when managing passwords, since the wire protocol for managing passwords goes back many years and new tools may need to talk to an older CredD and V.V.

Code changes

[ZKM] Changes to the CredD:

  1. if no Username is supplied or it is the empty string, then then the CredD will store tokens for the authenticated user.
  2. If a Username is supplied and the authenticated user matches it or is a member of CRED_SUPER_USERS then the CredD will look at Username and do the operation on their behalf.

These changes go into store_cred_handler() in store_cred.cpp, and in CredDaemon::check_creds_handler() in credd.cpp

[ZKM] Change for submit:

  1. Pass an empty string for the Username argument to do_store_cred() for Kerberos creds
  2. Stop sending the Username attribute in token request ads, and always let the CredD fill it in.

[TJ] Change for python bindings

  1. pass an empty string for Username argument when python passes None as the username for all of the methods on the CredD object that take a username except those that call do_store_cred() and pass a password.

[TJ] Changes for condor_store_cred

  1. If the invoker does not provide a username, and is not storing a password, pass an empty string to the Username field of do_store_cred()
